SENT.plain: Hughes' syndrome, or antiphospholipid syndrome, is thought to be the cause of one in four strokes in people aged less than 40 years
It is an antiinflammatory autoimmune disorder in which the blood has a tendency to clot too quickly
It can affect any artery or vein in the body and the main symptoms are thrombosis, pregnancy loss and the presence of antibodies
If detected it can be treated effectively
